bb.name: Advanced video training
bb.descrip: In this session, you'll learn how to shoot iPhone video like a boss. We won't be editing. Instead, we'll spend time looking at what's working and what's not on Omaha.com. We're also going to look at ways to make your videos better with new editing techniques and shooting tips.

bb.name: Basic HTML/CSS
bb.descrip: An introduction to making things for the web. If you can, bring a laptop with a good text editor installed. Suggestions: notepad++ for Windows, Sublime or TextWrangler for Macs. (If you're bumping Linux, presumably you've already got a good text editor installed.)

bb.name: Basic Javascript
bb.descrip: If HTML tags are the nouns of the web and CSS rules are adjectives, Javascript functions are the verbs. In this session, we'll learn some basic syntax for the scripting language that powers the Internet. You'll want to have some familiarity with HTML and CSS before attending this training. Also, it would be a good idea to bring a laptop with a good text editor installed (see above).

bb.name: Using Twitter like a pro
bb.descrip: Twitter is where the action is. Learn to use it to find story leads and connect with readers. Make sure you have a Twitter account set up and Google Chrome installed (especially if you want to follow along on your own computer).

bb.name: Spreadsheets
bb.descrip: Search, sort and sift data to add quantitative heft to your reporting. A laptop would be useful, and you'll need a Google account to follow along.

bb.name: Introduction to SQL
bb.descrip: If you have more data than Excel can handle, Structured Query Language is your friend. In this session we'll be using a browser add-on for Firefox called SQLite Manager.

bb.name: Social media research
bb.descrip: Tips and tricks for mining social media sites for information about people.

bb.name: Chartbeat
bb.descrip: An introduction to web analytics, and why you should care about how readers use Omaha.com.

bb.name: Making a "Big Story"
bb.descrip: Got a big story? Use this tool to blow it up proper for the web.

bb.name: Data literacy
bb.descrip: We'll talk about how to find data on your beat, strategies for negotiating with truculent bureaucrats, sanity checks and the gift of paranoia.

bb.name: Introduction to Python, part 1
bb.descrip: Python is a programming language that can help automate reporting tasks, scrape data from the web, bake cakes, travel through time ... and more! This is a basic overview. We'll be using Python 2.7, so make sure you have that and a good text editor installed.

bb.name: Introduction to Python, part 2
bb.descrip: A hands-on follow-up to the introductory session. We'll go over basic data structures in Python and scrape a simple web page.

bb.name: Interactive maps
bb.descrip: So you have a bunch of addresses you want to plot on an interactive map. This session will get you started. Make sure you have a Google account.

bb.name: Backgrounding
bb.descrip: Learn how to use web tools to background sources, suspects and significant others. (Kidding!) (But really.) You don't need to bring anything except for a notebook.

bb.name: DocumentCloud
bb.descrip: If you have documents that would help readers understand your story, DocumentCloud is your amigo. In this session, we'll walk you through how to upload and annotate newsworthy documents.

bb.name: Video, redux
bb.descrip: Video assignment editor Zach Long talks about some simple methods to develop videos within the world of newspapers. The ability to make something from nothing often yields the greatest results.

bb.name: Inclusiveness
bb.descrip: Reporter Andrea Kszystyniak talks about inclusive language.

bb.name: Weather
bb.descrip: Sooner or later, we all get tapped to write about weather. In this session, reporter Nancy Gaarder will walk us through some online tools that make doing so easier: Storm and tornado damage reports, real-time severe weather maps, regional lists of rain totals and more. Learn the differences between the National Weather Service and its sister agencies so you know where to turn for information.

bb.name: Managing projects
bb.descrip: Columnist Erin Grace will discuss how a one-column idea turned into an excellent three-column series about access to mental health care. We'll go over the genesis of the series, the intricacies of reporting deeply personal stories, the importance of editor buy-in and design time and other issues that arose along the way.

bb.name: Dealing with PDFs
bb.descrip: You asked for data. They gave you a PDF. In this session, we'll talk about some tools that can help you extract what you need.

bb.name: Batch scripting like a boss
bb.descrip: Use the command line to make your life easier! Automate rote tasks with simple scripts. This session will be focused on people who use Windows.
